---
title: "import_v1_3.json"
---

## High-level description
This JSON file represents a feature flag configuration for version 1.3. It defines two feature flags with different types (variant and boolean) and a segment for targeting specific users or groups.

## Code Structure
The JSON structure consists of three main sections: "version", "flags", and "segments". The "flags" array contains individual feature flag configurations, while the "segments" array defines user segments for targeting.

## Symbols

### Root Object
#### Description
The root object of the JSON file containing version information, feature flags, and segments.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| version | string | Version of the configuration format |
| flags | array | Array of feature flag configurations |
| segments | array | Array of segment definitions |

### Flag Object
#### Description
Represents a single feature flag configuration with properties defining its behavior and targeting rules.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| key | string | Unique identifier for the flag |
| name | string | Display name of the flag |
| type | string | Type of the flag (e.g., "VARIANT_FLAG_TYPE", "BOOLEAN_FLAG_TYPE") |
| description | string | Description of the flag's purpose |
| enabled | boolean | Whether the flag is globally enabled or disabled |
| variants | array | (Optional) Array of variant configurations for variant flags |
| rules | array | (Optional) Array of targeting rules for variant flags |
| rollouts | array | (Optional) Array of rollout configurations for boolean flags |
| metadata | object | Additional metadata associated with the flag |

### Variant Object
#### Description
Defines a specific variant for a variant flag, including its key, name, description, and associated data.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| key | string | Unique identifier for the variant |
| name | string | Display name of the variant |
| description | string | Description of the variant |
| attachment | object | (Optional) Additional data associated with the variant |

### Rule Object
#### Description
Defines targeting rules for a variant flag, specifying which segment to target and the distribution of variants.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| segment | string | Key of the segment to target |
| rank | number | Priority of the rule |
| distributions | array | Array of distribution configurations for variants |

### Rollout Object
#### Description
Defines rollout configurations for boolean flags, including targeting specific segments or percentage-based rollouts.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| description | string | Description of the rollout configuration |
| segment | object | (Optional) Segment-based targeting configuration |
| threshold | object | (Optional) Percentage-based rollout configuration |

### Segment Object
#### Description
Defines a user segment with matching criteria for targeting specific users or groups.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| key | string | Unique identifier for the segment |
| name | string | Display name of the segment |
| match_type | string | Type of matching to apply (e.g., "ANY_MATCH_TYPE") |
| description | string | Description of the segment's purpose |
| constraints | array | Array of constraint objects defining the segment's criteria |

### Constraint Object
#### Description
Defines a specific constraint for a segment, specifying the property to evaluate and the comparison criteria.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| type | string | Type of comparison (e.g., "STRING_COMPARISON_TYPE") |
| property | string | Name of the property to evaluate |
| operator | string | Comparison operator (e.g., "neq" for not equal) |
| value | string | Value to compare against |

## Dependencies
This JSON file does not have any external dependencies as it is a data configuration file.

## Configuration
The file itself serves as a configuration for feature flags and segments. The main configuration options are defined within the "flags" and "segments" arrays.

## Error Handling
As a JSON configuration file, there is no explicit error handling. However, the structure and content of the file should adhere to the expected schema to be properly parsed and used by the system consuming this configuration.

## API/Interface Reference
This JSON file likely serves as input for a feature flag management system. The structure and content of the file define the API for configuring feature flags and segments within that system.
